--- Ian Badcoe <ian_badcoe@...> wrote:

> Hi,
> 	I've been spouting this idea that a modular
> evolving system (NEAT or 
> otherwise) would have to define (and eventually
> evolve) the interfaces 
> between the modules for quite a while now, and I'm
> curious to know whether 
> people have any opinions on the approach, e.g. good,
> bad, indifferent, or 
> you just don't get it?

I think modules are good, but I have not come across
the problem that would be suited to them.  I think
potentially two or more modules would be very powerful
and efficient.  As I see it, each module is an ANN,
and they connect via some of their inputs and outputs.
 As you say, both the ANNs and their interfaces should
be evolved.  What we need is a good problem.

I'm still waiting for someone to tackle my
"Sailchallenge" problem, which can be handled by a
single ANN.  So people are not generally looking for
hard problems that would really benefit from modules.

m

Mitchell Timin
